alert.note: Alert for Bryce Canyon Country; Central Mountains; Eastern Juab, Millard Counties; Lower Washington County; Sanpete Valley; Sevier Valley; Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah; Upper Sevier River Valleys; Zion National Park (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 11 at 10:17PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... ...FLOOD WATCH IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Utah, including the following areas, Central Mountains, Eastern Juab/Millard Counties, Sanpete Valley, Sevier Valley, Bryce Canyon Country, Southern Mountains, Upper Sevier River Valleys, Lower Washington County, Southwest Utah and Zion National Park. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in debris flows on area burn scars, flooding of slot canyons, normally dry washes, slickrock areas, and other low-lying flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood The Flood Watch that was in effect through midnight tonight is cancelled for a portion of Utah, including the following areas, Central Mountains, Eastern Juab/Millard Counties, Sanpete Valley, Sevier Valley, Bryce Canyon Country, Southern Mountains, Upper Sevier River Valleys, Lower Washington County, Southwest Utah and Zion National Park. Flooding is no longer expected to pose a threat. Please continue to heed remaining road closures.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Bryce Canyon Country; Central Mountains; Eastern Juab, Millard Counties; Lower Washington County; Sanpete Valley; Sevier Valley; Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah; Upper Sevier River Valleys; Zion National Park
